object.property: Check for new version at startup
Load and use round selection automatically (if exists)
Use bin gate as TOF-plot y-range
LAKRITSI INI FILE COULD NOT BE FOUND (maybe)

If enabled, expected filename is:
INPUTDIR + SUBDIR + "/" + PREFIX + NUMBER + SUFFIX
If disabled, expected filename is:
INPURDIR + SUBDIR + NUMBER + "/bunches.dat"
(See from terminal window what file the program tried to open)

Start freq value for reference.
Set to -1 to disable.

Start freq value for ion-of-interest.
Set to -1 to disable.

What scan rounds to skip. Comma separated list of numbers. Syntax example:
"1-3,7" skips rounds 1,2,3,7.
Define the range of rounds that are wanted. If both are set to 0, the whole file is loaded.
Define the range of rounds that are wanted. If both are set to 0, the whole file is loaded.
Saves rounds to skip to the input directory to file 'skips'. Will be automatically loaded, if chosen so in the menu.
Last file number of automatic fitting.
First file number to start automatic fitting.
First file number to start automatic fitting.
Fit and makes output from all files. Handy, if you want to fit many files with same settings.

What data files to skip. Comma separated list of numbers. Syntax example:
"1-5,7" skips files 1,2,3,4,5,7.
Automatically split file to this amount of rounds and FITTING and OUTPUTTING results too.
Do not use 1st bunch after freq change
Mass number of ion. Used in: - TIME-OF-FLIGHT calculation - POST PROCESSING to get correct mass excesses.
Mass number of ion. Used in: - TIME-OF-FLIGHT calculation - POST PROCESSING to get correct mass excesses.
Mass number of ion. Used in: - TIME-OF-FLIGHT calculation - POST PROCESSING to get correct mass excesses.

Use to limit frequencies used in the fit.
Set to -1 to have no limit.

Use to limit frequencies used in the fit.
Set to -1 to have no limit.

Use to limit frequencies used in the fit.
Set to -1 to have no limit.

Use to limit frequencies used in the fit.
Set to -1 to have no limit.
Check, if you want to keep class boundaries the same even if new file loaded.
To further calculate Q-values etc in POST PROCESS, data will get this name.

Process the REFERENCE and MEASUREMENT datafiles.
MAKE SURE THAT THERE IS ONLY 1 ENTRY OF EACH! (ie. Ca42_2 can only appear once!) TIME ORDER does not matter.
REFERENCE FILE includes references - only one element please!
MEASUREMENT FILE one element only too.
Program picks closest refererences for each measurement automagically.

This affects ion-of-interest uncertainty :
d_freq_ion = sqrt ( (time_diff_of_references*THIS*freq_ion)² + stat_err²)

This affects ion-of-interest uncertainty :
d_freq_ion = sqrt ( (time_diff_of_references*THIS*freq_ion)² + stat_err²)
Number of reference resonances found in datafile.
Number of measurement resonances found in datafile.
Amount of measurements, that has references on both sides - before and after.
Added to freq_ratio and mass excess uncertainty after multiplication with (A_ref - A_meas).
Added at the very end to freq_ration, mass excess and to Q-value uncertainties.
Insert element here, ie. '42Ca', to get mass excess value from AME2003 table.
Recalculates values, if changed: - mass excess - B-field fluctuation - A of reference or measurement
Used to identify THIS set of references and measurements.

This will generate 3 output files: - APPENDS to file that is defined in "Resultfile": (FINAL q-value, mass exc. etc) - APPENDS file defined in "Individuals": (outputs EACH time, q-value, m_exc, freq_ratio) - OVERWRITES file defined in "Gnuplot": (helpfile for gnuplot, plotting instructions to plot all individual q_vals, m_exc, f-ratio)
Note: If files exists, those will be overwritten!
